para_sentences.para_0: At this point, you should be able to answer all of the following questions.
para_sentences.para_1: You should now be able to use comparison and logical operators to write conditions, write if statements to create branch points in your code, and write while loops and for loops to repeat sections of code.
para_sentences.para_2: If you are unsure of any of these answers, take some time to review the course materials. Feel free to post questions in Piazza or Teams. Next week's lessons will be easier if you have invested in mastering this week's learning outcomes.
para_sentences.para_3: Check the Explorations and Task List in the Lesson 3 - Overview to review learning materials and make sure you have completed all required activities for this week.

ul_0: How do you write comparisons and logical expressions?
How can you make your program choose between two (or more) possible paths?
How can you make your program repeat certain instructions?
What does it mean to "nest" if statements or loops?
What significance does indentation have in Python?

heading_sentences: Review - Comparison & Logical Operators  Conditional Execution  Iteration  Code Tracing
